medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Approximately 1 year before admission, the patient began to have intermittent headaches and gradual onset of difficulty with word finding and writing, without changes in cognition, memory or personality, or sensorimotor deficits. Ten months before admission, MRI showed enhancement of the genu and rostrum of the corpus callosum, with T2-weighted signal abnormality in the left frontal, temporal, and parietal lobes. The patient experienced a generalized tonic-clonic seizure 5.5 months before admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: At 26 years old, the patient developed fever, fatigue, painful oral and genital ulcers, arthralgias, and erythematous nodular skin lesions. He was treated with immunosuppressive agents, including colchicine, mycophenolate mofetil, and prednisone. Methotrexate was started approximately 6 months prior to the neurologic symptoms.
medical_history.family_history: His mother had hypertension; his father and brother were well. There was no family history of neurologic or rheumatologic diseases.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was of Korean ancestry, born in the United States, worked in an office, was married without children, and did not drink alcohol, smoke, or use illicit drugs.
